result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrell D Hilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Montrell D Hilson in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Defendant Montrell D Hilson in custody.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for sentencing hearing today.  On motion of the State and upon agreement of defense, Court VACATES prior guilty plea (entered on 6/5/15) and REOPENS judgment of conviction.  State files amended information.  Court allows amendment on Count 1, charge is amended to Obstructing an Officer, contrary to Wis. Stats. Sec. 946.41(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Defendant enters plea of GUILTY as to amended charge.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire and addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Montrell D Hilson in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.   Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 on 6/26/15 at 8:30 a.m.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
TOT to Justice Point:  no firearms; no weapons; no controlled substances or alcohol; urine screens.  Court also ordered all No Contact Orders remain in full force and effect.
Parties  stipulate to bail in the amount of $1,500.00 cash.

Defense counsel advised that he will be in another county and requested a later time.  Case  is moved to 11:00 a.m.
